pull.title: refactor: validation: mark CheckBlockIndex as const
pull.body: While reviewing another PR, I [noticed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31405#discussion_r2056509235) that `ChainstateManager::CheckBlockIndex()`  is not a `const` method. To try and assert that this method was not causing any side-effects, I modified the method to make it `const`. It did not surface any errors, but I think it would be good to merge this change regardless, even if `CheckBlockIndex` is only used in regtest.

It does not modify any logical state. This change is required
for future const-correctness commits.

rename.from: refactor: validation: mark CheckBlockIndex as const
rename.to: refactor: validation: mark CheckBlockIndex as const

events.body:
Concept ACK

Don't really love duplicating `GetAll` in the second commit, but if there is no better solution, marking CBI as const seems more important.

Concept ACK

I wrote this simpler approach here https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/commit/fe13fa082e3d6befa6d5332428584570ead608ab after seeing you mentioning it last week. I think making sure that all block indexes are declared const in the method might be beneficial though. Maybe instead of adding a separate `GetAll` method just make it const and then declare the chainstate pointers as const in the for loop?

events.body:
Force-pushed to deduplicate the `GetAll()` overloads by adding a `GetAllImpl()` templated helper, addressing @mzumsande's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32364#pullrequestreview-2804523333).

> I wrote this simpler approach here [TheCharlatan@fe13fa0](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/commit/fe13fa082e3d6befa6d5332428584570ead608ab) after seeing you mentioning it last week. I think making sure that all block indexes are declared const in the method might be beneficial though. Maybe instead of adding a separate `GetAll` method just make it const and then declare the chainstate pointers as const in the for loop?

Allowing a `const ChainstateManager` to modify its `Chainstate` logical state feels like a const-correctness violation to me. If you agree that's true, then I don't think the shorter diff is a worthwhile trade-off. Furthermore, there are other places (such as `GetPruneRange()`) that would benefit from a `GetAll() const`, so I think this is worth adding?

     SteadyClock::duration GUARDED_BY(::cs_main) time_post_connect{};
 
+    //! Internal helper for GetAll() overloads.
+    //! @see GetAll() const
+    //! @see GetAll()
+    template <typename T>
+    auto GetAllImpl(T* self) const
